info.title: Bit2Me API Gateway
info.description:
# Introduction üëè Welcome to Bit2Me as API. We help individuals, exchanges, mining pools, tokens issuers, investment funds, governments and institutions to access, trade and manage cryptocurrencies and digital assets optimally. Being the access door to markets without friction, leaving obsolete the traditional financial system, the company is made up of more than 300 people: idealists, technological entrepreneurs, researchers, quantitative, financial traders, lawyers and engineers from large companies. We operate tirelessly around all time and world phases, with central offices in Spain, Europe. The documentation that follows gives you access to our Crypto market data, Trading, and Custody products. # Data hierarchy # Quickstart ## Official Repositories Are you a coder? Check out these GitHub repositories to kickstart your journey with us! - [Bit2Me Broker](https://github.com/bit2me-dev/bit2me-api-node-tool) - [Bit2Me Pro](https://github.com/bit2me-devs/trading-spot-samples) ## Postman Bit2Me OpenAPI specification can be downloaded and imported in postman in order to generate collections.
Our OpenAPI specification can be downloaded from [main page](#crypto-page).
OpenAPI files can be imported in postman and generate collections from them following next steps: 1. In postman left-hand sidebar, click **Import**. 2. Choose the OpenAPI file to be imported. 3. Configure the advanced options for the collection that will be generated. 4. Click **Import**. # Logical steps to operate with API 1. [[Auth]](#section/Authentication) Obtain your API Keys for production environment from Bit2Me team. 2. [[Subaccount]](#tag/Account/operation/createSubaccount) Using your API Key, generate sub accounts for each individual user. 3. [[KYC]](#tag/KYC/operation/initKycVerificationTransactionV3) Perform the KYC to the individual user. If you are a regulated entity and already perform an equivalent KYC on your side, our sales team will explain to you how to reuse it. 4. [[Funding]](#tag/Funding) your parent account with fiat money. **Important notes** * A minimum fiat balance is required to operate, as part of the initial set up there is a one time fiat transfer that must be sent to the fiat account that Bit2Me will tell you during the onboarding process * If you are a bank, the parent fiat account will be held in your own institution * During the day to day operations, fiat money must be funded to the main account. You should keep records of fiat money balances of each subaccount 4.1 [[Funding]](#tag/Funding/operation/getPocketReference) your account with EUR. 4.2 [[Funding]](#tag/Funding/operation/createOrderProforma) your account with BRL. 4.3 [Funding] your account with ARS. (Soon) *If you're looking for USD, please get in touch with our sales team. Currently this is only available in Bit2Me Pro. 5. [[Funding]](#tag/Wallet/operation/findAddressesOrCreateOne) your account with crypto. 6. Obtain [[Market]](#tag/Market) information for price and rates. * [Get a list of assets](#tag/Market/operation/currencyAssets) * [Get ticker information for currency pair](#tag/Market/operation/currencyChart) 7. [[Wallet]](#tag/Wallet/operation/createTransaction) Create proforma transaction with the buy, sell or exchange operation you want to execute. After that: 7.1 [[Wallet]](#tag/Wallet/operation/performTransaction) Execute the proforma transaction you created earlier. 8. [[Trading]](#tag/Pro-(Trading-Spot)) Use Bit2Me Pro to do your high-frequency trading. * [Deposit funds into your Bit2Me Pro account](/trading-spot-rest#tag/Funding/paths/~1v1~1trading~1wallet~1deposit/post) * [Place an order](/trading-spot-rest#tag/Trading/paths/~1v1~1trading~1order/post) 9. [[Earn]](#tag/Earn) Deposit or withdraw crypto from earn protocols. * [List supported assets](#tag/Earn/operation/getEarnAssetsV2) * [Get assets annual percentage yields](#tag/Earn/operation/getApysEffectivesV2). * [List subaccount earn wallets](#tag/Earn/operation/getEarnWallets). * [Deposit/withdraw cryptos in earn](#tag/Earn/operation/createEarnMovement). 10. [[Transfers]](#tag/Transfers) Move money between users (peer to peer): * [First create a transfer from the origin user](#tag/Transfers/operation/createOrder). * [Then claim the transfer for the destination user](#tag/Transfers/operation/claimUserPendingOrders). 11. [[Withdraw]](#tag/Wallet/operation/createTransaction) your fiat. 12. [[Withdraw]](#tag/Wallet/operation/createTransaction) your crypto.
> **`IMPORTANT: Logical steps are not examples, if you're looking for them, check the next section.`** # Use cases The following are some common use cases that illustrate how our API can be leveraged: 1. **Perform KYC process** * In order to perfom the KYC process first step is [complete subaccount data](#tag/Account/operation/updateAccount) following the examples in linked section. Following information must be provided { "person": { "name": , "surname": , "birthDate": , "nationalityCountryCode": , }, "profile": { "langCode": , "currencyCode": , "timeZone": } } * Is mandatory to [add an address to the subaccount](#tag/Account/operation/createAddress) following the examples in linked section. * [Init verification identity process](#tag/KYC/operation/initKycVerificationTransactionV3). This process has a predefined number of retries, once the limit has been overcomed, contact with our support department in order to reset it. [Remaining retries can be checked](#tag/KYC/operation/canRetryIdentityVerification) following the examples in linked section. 2. **Enable main account google authenticator 2fa** * [Retrieve 2fa user verification](#tag/Access/operation/getSfaTypeAndInitProcess) following the examples in linked section. Sfatype is obtained in the response. A valid 2fa code is sent using indicated sfaType. * [Start 2fa enablement process](#tag/Account/operation/settingsEnable2faStart) following the examples in linked section.\ This endpoint returns a secret that has to be used to configure google authenticator and generate valid 2fa codes.\ Following headers must be sent: * x-totp: [[2fa-code obtained in previous step]] * x-totp-type: [[sfaType obtained in previous response]] * [End 2fa enablement process](#tag/Account/operation/settingsEnable2faEnd) following the examples in linked section. 3. **Enable subaccount google authenticator 2fa** * [Start subaccount 2fa enablement process](#tag/Account/operation/initSubaccount2faProcess) following the examples in linked section.\ This endpoint returns a secret that has to be used to configure google authenticator and generate valid 2fa codes. * [End subaccount 2fa enablement process](#tag/Account/operation/endSubaccount2faProcess) following the examples in linked section. 4. **Deposit crypto in subaccount**\ Subaccount users can receive crypto from a network address. Following steps should be done to achieve this action: * [Create subaccount crypto pocket](#tag/Wallet/operation/createPocket).\ If subaccount doesn't have a crypto pocket first step is to create one. * [Get unique address for crypto pocket](#tag/Wallet/operation/getAddress).\ Once subaccount crypto pocket is created, unique address can be generated. * Receive cryptos in crypto pocket using generated address.\ In order to transfer assets from another platform, initiate a withdrawal from that account and paste this address into the destination field. * Once the operation has been processed and the funds received in the pocket, a notification of type "wallet.trx.confirmed" will be sent through [websockets](#section/Websockets). 5. **Fiat deposit** * For EUR: [Check your bank accounts](#tag/Funding/operation/getPocketReference) and make a fiat transfer. * For BRL: [Create a deposit proforma](#tag/Funding/operation/createOrderProforma). { "amount": "10", "description": "BRL deposit", "currency": "BRL", "feeType": "REA", "orderType": "deposit", "destination?": { "type": "pocket", "value": "" }, "method": { "type": "hub-latam", } } 5.1. **Receiving fiat deposits notifications** When a fiat deposit is done (via bank transfer) a notification is generated via [websockets](#section/Websockets). Multiple notifications types can be generated related to fiat deposits: * `wallet-transaction-v1` * `teller-order-v1` * `teller.deposit.transfer.success` * `teller.deposit.transfer.error` More information of this notifications can be found in websockets previously provided link. 6. **Calculate pocket balances** * A pocket is needed. Pocket balance can be checked for fiat and crypto pockets.\ Same operation can be used for subaccounts. * [Get pocket balance](#tag/Wallet/operation/getPocketData) following examples in linked section 7. **Crypto buy operation**\ To perform a buy operation follow next steps: * [Generate a proforma](#tag/Wallet/operation/createTransaction) with following body { "operation": "buy", "pair": "BTC/EUR", "amount": "100", "currency": "EUR" } With previous example, a proforma for an operation of buying 100 EUR of BTC is created. In the response, the **id** of the generated proforma is obtained. * [Execute proforma confirmation](#tag/Wallet/operation/performTransaction) using previously obtained **id** 8. **Crypto sell operation**\ To perform a sell operation follow next steps: * [Generate a proforma](#tag/Wallet/operation/createTransaction) with following body { "operation": "sell", "pair": "BTC/EUR", "amount": "0.001", "currency": "BTC" } With previous example, a proforma for an operation of selling 0.001 BTC is created. In the response, the **id** of the generated proforma is obtained. * [Execute proforma confirmation](#tag/Wallet/operation/performTransaction) using previously obtained **id** 9. **Crypto swap operation**\ To perform a swap operation follow next steps: * [Generate a proforma](#tag/Wallet/operation/createTransaction) with following body { "pocket": "", "amount": "0.001", "currency": "BTC", "destination": { "pocket": "" }, "type": "SEA", "userCurrency": "EUR" } With previous example, a proforma for an operation of swaping 0.001 BTC is created. In the response, the **id** of the generated proforma is obtained. * [Execute proforma confirmation](#tag/Wallet/operation/performTransaction) using previously obtained **id** **For more examples, go to [wallet create transaction](#tag/Wallet/operation/createTransaction) cURL section in requests samples side.** 10. **Deposit crypto in earn service** * [Check available assets](#tag/Earn/operation/getEarnAssetsV2) in earn service * [Create earn deposit](#tag/Earn/operation/createEarnMovement)\ The **pocketId** must be a valid pocket identifier for the same currency you are depositing.\ This operation can also be done for subaccounts as stated in linked section examples. 11. **Withdraw crypto from earn service** * [List user earn wallets](#tag/Earn/operation/getEarnWallets) for detailed information This endpoint can also be used for subaccounts as stated in linked sections example * [Create earn withdraw](#tag/Earn/operation/createEarnMovement)\ The **pocketId** must be a valid pocket identifier for the same currency you are withdrawing.\ This operation can also be done for subaccounts as stated in linked section examples. 12. **Fiat withdraw (EUR)** * An EUR pocket is needed * [Create withdraw proforma](#tag/Wallet/operation/createTransaction) following examples in linked section. { "pocket": "", "amount": "10", "currency": "EUR", "type": "SEA", "concept": "", "note": "", "destination": { "bankAccount": { "bankAccount": "", "country": "ES", "receiverName": "Test" } }, "userCurrency": "EUR" } These call will return an **id** field that has to be used in the next endpoint call. * To confirm previous generated transaction, 2fa is requested * [Execute withdraw order](#tag/Wallet/operation/performTransaction) following examples in linked section.\ The response contains an **id** that identifies the executed withdraw order 13. **Fiat withdraw (BRL)**
Fiat withdraws for Brazil are made using Pix instant payment platform. Following steps should be done to achieve this action: * An EUR pocket is needed * [Create pix withdraw proforma](#tag/Wallet/operation/createTransaction) following examples in linked section. { "pocket": "", "amount": "10", "currency": "EUR", "type": "SEA", "concept": "", "note": "", "destination": { "bankAccount": { "bankAccount": "", "country": "BR", "receiverName": "Test", "bankBranch": "02", "bankCode": "01", "bankName": "Bank test", "taxDocument": "" } }, "userCurrency": "EUR" } These call will return an **id** field that has to be used in the next endpoint call. * To confirm previous generated transaction, 2fa is requested * [Execute pix withdraw order](#tag/Wallet/operation/performTransaction) following examples in linked section.\ The response contains an **id** that identifies the executed withdraw order 14. **Withdraw crypto from subaccount**\ Subaccount users can send crypto to a network address. Next steps should be followed to achieve this action: * A subaccount crypto pocket with funds is needed. * [Create a transaction](#tag/Wallet/operation/createTransaction) following the examples in linked section.\ When generating transaction, following body example can be used: { "pocket": "", "currency": "ETH", "amount": "0.005", "type": "SEA", "destination": { "address": "", "network": "" }, // If needed // "queryParams" : "" "userCurrency": "EUR" } * To confirm previous generated transaction, first 2fa has to be requested * [Confirm previous generated transaction](#tag/Wallet/operation/performTransaction) using next endpoint # Rate Limit To ensure optimal performance and reliability of our API, we have implemented rate limits on the number of requests that can be made within a given timeframe. Below is a table detailing the allowed requests per minute (RPM) for different tiers:
Tier Max. RPM (request per minute)
Starter 600
Medium 800
Pro 1000
To request a new tier, [contact our support center](https://support.bit2me.com/en/support/home) All endpoints of this API are designed to enforce strict usage policies to ensure fair access and optimal performance for all users. As a result, any request that exceeds the allowed rate limits, may trigger a HTTP response with two types of error: 1. **`Code 429`**: The user has sent too many requests in a given timeframe. 2. **`Code 418`**: The user has been banned from accessing the API. **Important note**: It is essential for users to adhere to the specified guidelines to avoid these error responses and maintain uninterrupted access to the API's functionalities, otherwise you'll be banned. # Status üîî Stay updated with the latest platform updates and outages! Click the button below to **suscribe** to our service to receive all the news and announcements directly to your inbox. üëâ üëà # WebSockets This service has a websocket interface to communicate to the client all the notifications that happen in the platform. After the websocket connection you must send the JWT token or the API Key in order to authenticate the connection. If the authentication fails the websocket is closed immediately with code `4000`. WebSockets connection are limited by IP and also uses the same Rate Limiter as the HTTP calls: - If the maximum number of concurrent connections (50) from the same IP is exceeded a handshake error is returned with code `429`. - If the maximum number of messages sent (50 per second) from the same connection is exceeded, it will be closed with code `4001`. Please also note, that you can **ONLY** receive events with a logged in account. ## Reconnect policy We recommend implementing an `on disconnect: reconnect` policy for WebSocket connections to our platform. This strategy ensures that, in the event of a connection interruption, the client will automatically attempt to reconnect, which enhances **resilience** and **user experience**. By maintaining an active connection and efficiently reestablishing it, interruptions in communication are minimized, and a **continuous flow of data is guaranteed**, which is essential for real-time applications. This practice not only optimizes performance but also contributes to **greater stability** in interactions with our platform. ## Code Snippets Examples **Example (browser-index.html)** ```Javascript

tags.name: Pro (Trading Spot)
tags.description:
# REST API The [REST API](/trading-spot-rest) is divided into groups of endpoints dedicated to different functionalities.
  • Market Data
  • Trading
  • Funding
  • WebSockets Authentication
API keys are required to call any of the account specific (private) API endpoints, such as the [trading](/trading-spot-rest#tag/Trading) and [funding](/trading-spot-rest#tag/Funding) endpoints. API keys are not required to call the [market data](/trading-spot-rest#tag/MarketData) endpoints. You can find different **code samples** and how to call authorized endpoints in the following [GitHub repository](https://github.com/bit2me-devs/trading-spot-samples). # REST Rate Limits Users using the [REST API](/trading-spot-rest) have a limit of requests per minute associated with an **IP address**. This rate limit could be found [here](#section/Rate-Limit). There are some endpoints with specific rate limits by **user account**:
Endpoint Description Max. RPS (request per second)
POST /v1/trading/order Create one order 15/sec
DELETE /v1/trading/order/{id} Delete one order 15/sec
DELETE /v1/trading/order Delete many orders 1/sec
GET /v1/trading/order Get orders 5/sec
GET /v1/trading/order/{id} Get one order 5/sec
GET /v1/trading/trade Get trades 5/sec
GET /v1/trading/order/{id}/trades Get trades of one order 5/sec
GET /v1/trading/wallet/balance Get balance 5/sec
POST /v1/trading/wallet/deposit Deposit funds from Wallet to Pro 1/sec
POST /v1/trading/wallet/withdraw Withdraw funds from Pro to Wallet 1/sec
There are some endpoints with specific rate limits by **IP address**:
Endpoint Description Max. RPS (request per second)
GET /v1/trading/candle Get OHLCV (open, highest, lowest, close, volume) information 5/sec
# WebSockets API The [WebSockets API](/trading-spot-websockets) offers real-time information and allows orders management. The user has to subscribe to channels in order to get real-time information, and the user has to send specific commands to the WebSockets server in order to manage the orders. Our WebSockets server provides [public channels](/trading-websockets#section/Public-channels), with information that can subscribe any user, and [private channels](/trading-websockets#section/Private-channels). To subscribe to the private channels the user must be logged in. You can find different **code samples** and how to call authorized endpoints in the following [GitHub repository](https://github.com/bit2me-devs/trading-spot-samples). # WebSockets Rate Limits Users using the [WebSockets API](/trading-spot-websockets) have a limit of messages per second associated with a connection and command. Review the maximum concurrent connection limit and the overall message per second limit at [WebSockets Rate Limit section](/#section/WebSockets) ‚ö†Ô∏è The connection will be aborted if the request limit has been reached. ‚ö†Ô∏è
Command Max. messages per second
Authenticate 1
Subscribe 50
Unsubscribe 50
AddOrder 10
AddOrders (batch orders) 1
CancelOrder 10
CancelOrders (batch orders) 1
CancelAllOrders 1
AutoCancelOrdersOnDisconnection 5
# Order Limits A rate limit applies to the number of orders clients can have open on each market at one time and the number they can add and cancel orders on each market per hour. These limits apply to all API types ([Rest API](/trading-spot-rest) and [WebSockets API](/trading-websockets)) and according to the tier established for the user:
User Purpose Max. Open Orders by symbol Max. Created/Cancelled Orders last hour by symbol
Standard General purpose 20 1000
Advanced Market makers, High-Frequency Trading 100 Up to 10000
To exceed these limits, contact our support center https://support.bit2me.com/en/support/home # FAQ Spot API supports one of following order types: - **market**: will be executed at the best price available in the order book. Runs immediately. The exact price of the operation is not guaranteed. - **limit**: allows you to buy or sell at a fixed **price** that you determine, although depending on how the market moves you can get a better price. It is executed when the market price reaches the set price. The order is not guaranteed to be executed - **stop-limit**: order has to set 2 prices: **stop price** and limit **price**. When the market reaches the **stop price** then the order becomes a **limit** order. > Orders expire every 30 days - automatically cancelled. For partially filled orders, they will also be canceled after 30 days and the unfilled order quantity is unlocked. > Cancelled **market maker** orders not partially filled are stored for 7 days. After that period they are automatically deleted from the system. # Errors
Code Description
AMOUNT_PRECISION_EXCEEDED The number of decimals in the indicated amount is greater than the maximum supported for this market
BUY_PRICE_IS_ABOVE_INITIAL_PRICE The indicated buy order price is higher than the initial price determined for this market not yet started
BUY_STOP_PRICE_IS_BELOW_INITIAL_PRICE The indicated stop buy order price is lower than the initial price determined for this market not yet started
CREATE_ORDERS_DISABLED_TEMPORALLY Order creation operations are temporarily disabled
CURRENCY_NOT_SUPPORTED Currency not supported
DELETE_CLOSED_ORDER The order you are trying to cancel is deleted or completed
DELETE_ORDERS_DISABLED_TEMPORALLY Order cancellation operations are temporarily disabled
DEPOSITS_DISABLED_TEMPORALLY Fund deposits are temporarily disabled
ERROR_CREATING_INTERNAL_ORDER There was an error creating the indicated order
ERROR_CREATING_ORDER There was an error creating orders
MARKET_CONFIG_NOT_FOUND The market does not exist or is disabled
MAX_CREATED_ORDERS_REACHED The maximum number of created orders allowed in the last hour for this market has been reached
MAX_OPEN_ORDERS_REACHED The maximum number of open orders allowed has been reached
MISSING_FROM_POCKET_ID The identifier of the wallet from which the funds came from has not been indicated
NOT_ENOUGH_BALANCE You do not have enough funds
NOT_ENOUGH_LIQUIDITY There is not enough liquidity in the market
ORDER_AMOUNT_GREATER_MARKET_MAX The order amount exceeds the maximum allowed for this market
ORDER_AMOUNT_LOWER_EQUAL_ZERO The order amount must be positive
ORDER_PRICE_LOWER_EQUAL_ZERO The price of the order must be positive
ORDER_SIZE_LOWER_MARKET_MIN The order is below minimum size (amount per price) required for the market
PRICE_GREATER_MARKET_MAX The order price is above maximum allowed for this market
ORDER_STOP_PRICE_LOWER_EQUAL_ZERO The order stop price must be positive
PRICE_LOWER_MARKET_MIN The order price is below minimum required for this market
PRICE_PRECISION_EXCEEDED The number of decimals in price is greater than the maximum allowed for this market
ONLY_LIMIT_ORDERS_ALLOWED Limit orders are only allowed to be created at this time
ORDER_AMOUNT_GREATER_TOTAL_AMOUNT_IN_PURCHASE The sell order amount exceeds the total buy liquidity for this market
ORDER_AMOUNT_GREATER_TOTAL_AMOUNT_IN_SALE The buy order amount exceeds the total sell liquidity for this market
ORDER_AMOUNT_LOWER_MARKET_MIN The order amount is below minimum required for this market
SELL_PRICE_IS_BELOW_INITIAL_PRICE The sell order price is below initial price for this market not yet started
SELL_STOP_PRICE_IS_ABOVE_INITIAL_PRICE The stop sell order price is above initial price for this market not yet started
TIME_IN_FORCE_INVALID The time in force value is not allowed in this order type
TRADING_WALLET_NOT_BALANCE Wallet has no balance
TRADING_WALLET_NOT_FOUND Wallet identifier not found
USER_IS_ALREADY_CREATING_ORDER The user is creating another order simultaneously
WITHDRAWS_DISABLED_TEMPORALLY Withdrawals are temporarily disabled

post.description: Generates an access token and refresh token that you can use to call other APIs.

x-codeSamples.label: cURL
x-codeSamples.source:
# Signin to embed subaccount
curl -X POST ${SERVER_URL}/v1/signin/embed
  -H 'Content-type: application/json'
  -d '{"accessToken":"<token>"}'

post.description: Authorize user by apiKey

x-codeSamples.label: Node
cURL
x-codeSamples.source:
# Get authorized token by apikey
curl -X POST ${SERVER_URL}/v1/signin/apikey
  -H 'Content-type: application/json'
  -H 'X-API-KEY: <api key>'
  -H 'api-signature: <sign message>'
  -H 'x-nonce: <nonce>'

get.description: Check active user verification and start the process

x-codeSamples.label: cURL
x-codeSamples.source:
# Get user 2fa type
curl -X GET ${SERVER_URL}/v2/signin/sfa
  -H 'X-API-KEY: <api key>'

get.description: Find all address by pocket ID and Network or create one new

x-codeSamples.label: cURL
x-codeSamples.source:
# Subaccount pocket addresses
curl -X GET ${SERVER_URL}/v2/wallet/pocket/{pocketId}/{network}/address
  -H 'Content-type: application/json'
  -H 'X-API-KEY: <api key>'
  -H 'X-SUBACCOUNT-ID: <subaccount id>'

post.description: Create a new pocket

currency.description:
Value obtained from 'symbol' field in v2/currency/assets

  Additional information of this endpoint is available in misc section

406.description: Pocket limit for a cryptocurrency exceeded

x-codeSamples.label: cURL
x-codeSamples.source:
# Create subaccount pocket
curl -X POST ${SERVER_URL}/v1/wallet/pocket
  -H 'Content-type: application/json'
  -H 'X-API-KEY: <api key>'
  -H 'X-SUBACCOUNT-ID: <subaccount id>'
  -d '
    {
      "currency":"BTC",
      "name":"Bitcoin pocket",
      "color":"0"
    }'

get.description: Get the data of a specific pocket or the data of all pockets of the user (if the *id* param is not set)

parameters.name: id
parameters.description:
With this parameter you can specify the pocket you want to get the data from.
If this parameter is not set, all pockets of the user are returned

x-codeSamples.label: cURL
x-codeSamples.source:
# Retrieve one pocket details
curl -X GET ${SERVER_URL}/v1/wallet/pocket?id=<pocketId>
  -H 'Content-type: application/json'
  -H 'X-API-KEY: <api key>'

# Retrieve all pocket details
curl -X GET ${SERVER_URL}/v1/wallet/pocket
  -H 'Content-type: application/json'
  -H 'X-API-KEY: <api key>'

# Subaccounts. Retrieve one pocket details
curl -X GET ${SERVER_URL}/v1/wallet/pocket?id=<pocketId>
  -H 'Content-type: application/json'
  -H 'X-API-KEY: <api key>'
  -H 'X-SUBACCOUNT-ID: <subaccount id>'

# Subaccounts. Retrieve all pocket details
curl -X GET ${SERVER_URL}/v1/wallet/pocket
  -H 'Content-type: application/json'
  -H 'X-API-KEY: <api key>'
  -H 'X-SUBACCOUNT-ID: <subaccount id>'

post.description: Executes a previuosly created transaction

401.description: User does not have verified his email

404.description: Proforma not found (it has expired or has never existed)

409.description: Insufficient funds in the instant service

412.description: Source pocket does not have enough funds to perform the transaction

x-codeSamples.label: Node
cURL
x-codeSamples.source:
# Execute previously created transaction
curl -X POST /v1/wallet/transaction
-H 'Content-type: application/json'
-H 'X-API-KEY: <api key>'
-d '{
    "proforma":"<proforma ID>"
  }'

# Subaccounts: Execute previously created transaction
curl -X POST /v1/wallet/transaction
-H 'Content-type: application/json'
-H 'X-API-KEY: <api key>'
-H 'X-SUBACCOUNT-ID: <subaccount id>'
-d '{
    "proforma":"<proforma ID>"
  }'

get.description:
Obtains all transactions related to a pocket. If pocketId is not specified, all user's transactions are returned.

 Transactions can be paginated using **offset** and **limit** parameters. For example, to get the third page and show 20 registers per page you would use the following query:
 ```
 /v1/wallet/transaction?offset=40&limit=20
 ```
 Multiple filtering options could be applied when retrieving transactions. Example:
 ```
 /v1/wallet/transaction?pocketId=9a2dfa96-2fb8-4b76-a9bd-83949c417540&type=deposit
 ```

parameters.name: pocketId
parameters.description: The pocket identifier to get the transactions or comma delimited list of pocket IDs

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Specify the number of entries to be skipped (0 by default)

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Specify the maximum number of entries to be returned (20 by default)

parameters.name: keyword
parameters.description: Specify a list (comma-separated values) of keywords to be used to filter the query

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Specify the transaction type to filter the entries to be returned (or comma delimited list of types)

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Specify the start date (ISO 8601) to filter the date (mandatory if the to parameter is set)

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: Specify the end date (ISO 8601) to filter the date (mandatory if the from parameter is set)

parameters.name: userCurrency
parameters.description: The user's currency (used to show a rate from it to Euro)

currency.description: The currency of the origin (only present for "outcome transactions")

amount.description: The total amount of "money" that is taken from origin (only present for "outcome transactions")

pocketId.description: The destination pocket ID of the transaction (null when class is "pocket" or "b2m")

pocketName.description: The destination pocket name (null when class is "pocket" or "b2m")

class.description:
Type of the origin:
- pocket: origin is another pocket
- network: origin is a cryptocurrency address
- b2m: origin is another Bit2Me user
- card: origin is a credit or debit card
- bank transfer: origin is a bank transfer

amount.description: The total amount of "money" that the destination receives

addressInBlacklist.description: Indicates if destination address is in blacklist

class.description:
Type of the destination:
- pocket: destination is another pocket
- network: destination is an cryptocurrency address
- b2m: destination is another Bit2Me user
- bankAccount: destination is a bank account

confirmationCount.description: The number of confirmations the transaction has.

post.description:
Creates a new proforma transaction (it includes an expiration time)

 If the *type* parameter is not specified, *REA* is used by default.

 The *destination* parameter only accepts one field (use *destination.address* to specify a crytocurrency address or *destination.pocket* to specify the ID of the destination pocket)

 **Security Constraints:** User's *email* **must** be validated in order to use this endpoint.

 For peer to peer transactions, a sell operation has to be made on source pocket and a buy operation has to be made on destination pocket

 **IMPORTANT:**  All blockchain withdrawals must be accompanied by Travel Rule information to be processed. Please [see](#tag/Funding/operation/provideTravelRuleInformation).

operation.description: This property is not necessary for other operation types

userCurrency.description: The user's currency (used to show a rate from it to Euro)

queryParams.description: Used for some cryptos that need extra parameters to do blockchain sendings. For example, memo in XRP.

401.description: User does not have verified his email

406.description: Source and destination are the same

412.description: Source pocket does not have enough funds to perform the transaction (code: not-enough-funds)

417.description: Destination amount must be greater than zero or the volume is too low or too high to perform the operation

x-codeSamples.label: Node
cURL
x-codeSamples.source:
# Subaccounts: Buy 100 EUR in BTC
curl -X POST /v1/wallet/transaction/proforma
-H 'Content-type: application/json'
-H 'X-API-KEY: <api key>'
-H 'X-SUBACCOUNT-ID: <subaccount id>'
-d '{
    "pocket":"<subaccount EUR pocket id>",
    "destination":{"pocket":"<subaccount BTC pocket id>"},
    "amount":"100",
    "currency":"EUR"
  }'

# Subaccounts: Sell 0.1 BTC
curl -X POST /v1/wallet/transaction/proforma
-H 'Content-type: application/json'
-H 'X-API-KEY: <api key>'
-H 'X-SUBACCOUNT-ID: <subaccount id>'
-d '{
    "pocket":"<subaccount BTC pocket id>",
    "destination":{"pocket":"<subaccount EUR pocket id>"},
    "amount":"0.1",
    "currency":"BTC"
  }'

# Subaccounts: Send cryptos to a network address
curl -X POST /v1/wallet/transaction/proforma
-H 'Content-type: application/json'
-H 'X-API-KEY: <api key>'
-H 'X-SUBACCOUNT-ID: <subaccount id>'
-d '{ 
      "pocket": "<UUID of a user subaccount crypto pocket>", 
      "currency": "ETHTEST",
      "amount": "0.005",
      "type": "SEA",
      "destination": {
          "address": "<Network address>",
          "network": "<Network name>"
      },
      "userCurrency": "EUR" 
    }'

# Examples with origin and destination pocket: Buy BTC with EUR
curl -X POST /v1/wallet/transaction/proforma
-H 'Content-type: application/json'
-H 'X-API-KEY: <api key>'
-d '{
      "pocket": "<UUID of an EUR pocket>", 
      "destination": { "pocket": "<UUID of a BTC pocket>" }, 
      "amount": "100", 
      "currency": "EUR" 
    }'


# Examples with origin and destination pocket: Sell BTC for EUR
curl -X POST /v1/wallet/transaction/proforma
-H 'Content-type: application/json'
-H 'X-API-KEY: <api key>'
-d '{ 
      "pocket": "<UUID of a BTC pocket>", 
      "destination": { "pocket": "<UUID of an EUR pocket>" }, 
      "amount": "0.002", 
      "currency": "BTC" 
    }'


# Examples with operation and without pair: Purchase via card in wallet
curl -X POST /v1/wallet/transaction/proforma
-H 'Content-type: application/json'
-H 'X-API-KEY: <api key>'
-d '{ 
      "operation": "purchase", 
      "origin": { 
        "creditcard": { "cardId": "<UUID of a card>" } 
      }, 
      "destination": { "pocket": "<UUID of a BTC pocket>" }, 
      "amount": "100", 
      "currency": "EUR" 
    }'


# Examples with operation and without pair: Purchase via card in launchpad
curl -X POST /v1/wallet/transaction/proforma
-H 'Content-type: application/json'
-H 'X-API-KEY: <api key>'
-d '{ 
      "operation": "launchpad-purchase", 
      "origin": { 
        "creditcard": { "cardId": "<UUID of a card>" } 
      }, 
      "destination": { "launchpad": "<UUID of launchpad project>" }, 
      "amount": "100", 
      "currency": "EUR" 
    }'


# Examples with operation and without pair: Purchase via EUR pocket in launchpad
curl -X POST /v1/wallet/transaction/proforma
-H 'Content-type: application/json'
-H 'X-API-KEY: <api key>'
-d '{ 
      "operation": "launchpad-purchase", 
      "pocket": "<UUID of an EUR pocket>", 
      "destination": { "launchpad": "<UUID of launchpad project>" }, 
      "amount": "100", 
      "currency": "EUR" 
    }'


# Examples with operation and pair: Buy BTC with EUR
curl -X POST /v1/wallet/transaction/proforma
-H 'Content-type: application/json'
-H 'X-API-KEY: <api key>'
-d '{ 
      "operation": "buy", 
      "pair": "BTC/EUR", 
      "amount": "100", 
      "currency": "EUR" 
    }'


# Examples with operation and pair: Sell BTC for EUR
curl -X POST /v1/wallet/transaction/proforma
-H 'Content-type: application/json'
-H 'X-API-KEY: <api key>'
-d '{ 
      "operation": "sell", 
      "pair": "BTC/EUR", 
      "amount": "0.002", 
      "currency": "BTC" 
    }'

# Withdraw
  curl -X POST /v1/wallet/transaction/proforma
  -H 'Content-type: application/json'
  -H 'X-API-KEY: <api key>'
  -d '{
        "pocket": "<UUID of an EUR pocket>",
        "amount": "10",
        "currency": "EUR",
        "type": "SEA",
        "concept": "",
        "note": "",
        "destination": {
          "bankAccount": {
              "bankAccount": "<IBAN bank account>",
              "country": "ES",
              "receiverName": "Test",
          }
        },
        "userCurrency": "EUR"
      }'

# Withdraw (Brazil)
  curl -X POST /v1/wallet/transaction/proforma
  -H 'Content-type: application/json'
  -H 'X-API-KEY: <api key>'
  -d '{
        "pocket": "<UUID of an EUR pocket>",
        "amount": "10",
        "currency": "EUR",
        "type": "SEA",
        "concept": "",
        "note": "",
        "destination": {
          "bankAccount": {
              "bankAccount": "<IBAN bank account>",
              "country": "BR",
              "receiverName": "Test",
              "bankBranch": "02",
              "bankCode": "01",
              "bankName": "Bank test",
              "taxDocument": "<CPF-CNPS>"
          }
        },
        "userCurrency": "EUR"
      }'
      
# Send cryptos to a network address
curl -X POST /v1/wallet/transaction/proforma
-H 'Content-type: application/json'
-H 'X-API-KEY: <api key>'
-d '{ 
      "pocket": "<UUID of a user crypto pocket>", 
      "currency": "ETHTEST",
      "amount": "0.005",
      "type": "SEA",
      "destination": {
          "address": "<Network address>",
          "network": "<Network name>"
      },
      "userCurrency": "EUR" 
    }'

get.description: Get the details of a transaction

parameters.name: userCurrency
parameters.description: The user's currency (used to show a rate from it to Euro)

amount.description: The total amount of "money" that is taken from origin.

class.description:
Type of the origin:
 - pocket: origin is another pocket
 - network: origin is a cryptocurrency address
 - b2m: origin is another Bit2Me user
 - card: origin is a credit or debit card
 - bank transfer: origin is a bank transfer

amount.description: The total amount of "money" that the destination receives

addressInBlacklist.description: Indicates if destination address is in blacklist

class.description:
Type of the destination:
 - pocket: destination is another pocket
 - network: destination is an cryptocurrency address
 - b2m: destination is another Bit2Me user
 - bankAccount: destination is a bank account

confirmationCount.description: The number of confirmations the transaction has.

fee.description:
Different fees for the transaction:
  network: only present when type is "withdrawal"
  flip: only present when the transaction has a currency convertion (instant)

put.description: Updates some data of the specified transaction

get.description: Get a list of earn wallets
Retrieves full information of selected wallet

Retrieves list of wallet movements.

 Movements can be paginated using **offset** and **limit** parameters. For example, to get the third page and show 20 registers per page you would use the following query:
 ```
 /v1/earn/wallets/{walletId}/movements?offset=40&limit=20
 ```

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Specify the number of entries to be skipped (0 by default)

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Specify the maximum number of entries to be returned (20 by default)

get.description: Retrieves user summary
Retrieves summary of movements per operation (deposit, reward, withdrawal)
Retrieves full list of supported assets in earn service

get.summary: Get annual percentage yields by currency
get.description: Get current annual percentage yields by currency. Value of currency is an object wich reward type as a key and annual percentage yield as value

200.description: Returns the annual percentage yields found

get.description: Retrieves rewards configuration for user wallets

200.description: Return rewards settings for user wallets

get.description: Retrieves rewards configuration for selected wallet

patch.description: Update wallet reward configuration for selected wallet

get.description: Retrieves full list of rewards summary for selected wallet

post.description: Create a deposit/withdrawal in earn service

requestBody.description: The details to create the movement

412.description: Not enough funds, user not elegible for earn or invalid currency

post.description:
Starts the process to enable the two-factor authentication.
After calling this endpoint you must call *(PUT) /v1/account/settings/sfa* and pass a TOTP to finish the process.

qrImage.description: QR image containing the otpauth URL for Google Authenticator (e.g. data:image/png;base64,iVB...YII=)

name.description: The name to use with Google Authenticator

x-codeSamples.label: cURL
x-codeSamples.source:
# Start 2fa enablement
curl -X POST ${SERVER_URL}/v1/account/settings/sfa
  -H 'Content-type: application/json'
  -H 'X-API-KEY: <api key>'
  -H 'X-TOTP: <2fa code>'
  -H 'X-TOTP-TYPE: <['gauth', 'sms', 'email']>'
  -d '{}'

put.description:
Ends the process to enable the two-factor authentication.
With this endpoint we make sure that the TOTP on the server side and the TOTP on the client side match.

requestBody.description: The details to end the process

x-codeSamples.label: cURL
x-codeSamples.source:
# End 2fa enablement
curl -X PUT ${SERVER_URL}/v1/account/settings/sfa
  -H 'Content-type: application/json'
  -H 'X-API-KEY: <api key>'
  -d '{
    "totp": <2fa code>,
  }'

post.description: Init subaccount google authenticator 2fa process

requestBody.description: The details to init subaccount 2fa process
The details to end subaccount 2fa process

get.description: Gets a response based on whether the user can retry the verification process

curl -X GET ${SERVER_URL}/v1/account/verify/identity/verification/retry
  -H 'Content-type: application/json'
  -H 'X-API-KEY: <api key>'
  -H 'X-SUBACCOUNT-ID: <subaccount id>'

post.description:
The Travel Rule is a regulation that requires transfers of funds, including crypto assets, to include information about the originator and the beneficiary to prevent money laundering and terrorist financing. [More information](https://support.bit2me.com/en/support/solutions/articles/35000278021-travel-rule-frequently-asked-questions)

When you create a blockchain withdrawal, its status will be set to `waiting-user-information`. To proceed with the transaction, you must send the required Travel Rule parameters. If this information is not provided, the operation will remain in this status and will be automatically canceled within a few hours.

walletType.description: Wallet type where the user is sending the information. It coud be an exchange or selfhosted wallet.

exchangeName.description: Exchange name if the operation is send to it.

walletOwnership.description: If sending to a own or others address.

personType.description: If sending to a person or company.

name.description: Beneficiary person name or company name.

post.description: Changes an order status from "waiting-user" to "cancelled" after the user accepting the transaction

get.description: Gets order status. If no order is found, "pending" status is returned as default value.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The order ID or the wallet proforma ID

status.description: The status of the order (accepted or pending)

get.description:
Get user transactions.
Transactions can be paginated using **offset** and **limit** parameters. For example, to get the third page and show 20 registers per page you would use the following query:

``` /v2/wallet/transaction?offset=40&limit=20 ```

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Specify the number of entries to be skipped (0 by default)

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Specify the maximum number of entries to be returned (20 by default)

parameters.name: year
parameters.description: Filter movements to this specific year

parameters.name: currency
parameters.description: Currency in which movements has been involved

get.description: Get country regions

ExplorerMultipleAddressParam.name: addr
ExplorerMultipleAddressParam.description: The address id (use a comma delimited list to use multiple addresses)

QuerySubtypeParam.name: subtype
QuerySubtypeParam.description: Specify the transaction subtype to filter the entries to be returned (or comma delimited list of subtypes)

QueryMethodParam.name: method
QueryMethodParam.description: Specify the transaction method to filter the entries to be returned (or comma delimited list of methods)

TOTP (Time-based One-Time Password).name: X-TOTP
TOTP (Time-based One-Time Password).description:
There are some operations that require 2FA authentication. Following headers must be included in this cases:
* Header x-totp - contains 2FA code

* Header x-totp-type - contains the type of how the 2FA code was received (Type: ['gauth', 'sms', 'email'])

‚ö†Ô∏è For subaccount operations the totp-type always will be 'gauth'

currency.description: Currency symbol, it should be an allowed currency

isNew.description: Currency added on earn in the last 7 days

currenciesRewardAllowed.description: Currency rewards allowed with their info

extraYield.description: Extra Yield by currency applied in the reward

stateCode.description:
Value obtained from 'fips' (Federal Information Processing Standard  (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Federal_Information_Processing_Standards)) field in /v1/misc/country/{countryISOCode}/region response.

  Additional information of this endpoint is available in misc section

TransactionSubsFeeTypeParam.description:
Indicates if the amount of the transaction is what the receiver will get or what will be deducted from the sender's balance:
 * SEA: Acronym for Send Exact Amount
 * REA: Acronym for Receive Exact Amount
